verses.latin: Anno secundo Darii regis, mense octavo, factum est verbum Domini ad Zachariam filium Barachiæ filii Ado, prophetam, dicens:
verses.english: In the second year of the reign of Darius, in the eighth month, the word of the Lord came to Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying:

verses.latin: Iratus est Dominus contra patres vestros.
verses.english: The Lord was angry with your fathers.

verses.latin: Et dices ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Convertimini ad me, dicit Dominus exercituum, et convertar ad vos, dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: And you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: “Return to me,” says the Lord of hosts, “and I will return to you,” says the Lord of hosts.’

verses.latin: Ne sitis sicut patres vestri, ad quos clamabant prophetæ priores, dicentes: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Convertimini de viis vestris malis, et de cogitationibus vestris pessimis: et non audierunt, neque attenderunt ad me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Do not be like your fathers, to whom the former prophets cried out, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: “Turn now from your evil ways and from your evil deeds.”’ But they did not listen, nor did they pay attention to me, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Patres vestri ubi sunt? et prophetæ, numquid in sempiternum vivent?
verses.english: Your fathers, where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?

verses.latin: Verumtamen verba mea, et præcepta mea, quæ mandavi servis meis prophetis, numquid non conprehenderunt patres vestros? Et conversi sunt, et dixerunt: Sicut cogitavit Dominus exercituum facere nobis secundum vias nostras, et secundum opera nostra, sic fecit nobis.
verses.english: But my words and my decrees, which I commanded my servants the prophets, did they not reach your fathers? So they turned and said, ‘As the Lord of hosts purposed to do to us according to our ways and according to our deeds, so he has done to us.’

verses.latin: In die vigesimo quarto mensis undecimi, iste est mensis Sabath, factum est verbum Domini ad Zachariam filium Barachiæ filii Ado, prophetam, dicens:
verses.english: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month of Shebat, the word of the Lord came to Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying:

verses.latin: Vidi per noctem, et ecce vir ascendens super equum rufum, et ipse stabat inter myrteta, quæ erant in profundo: et post eum equi rufi, varii, et albi.
verses.english: I saw by night, and behold, a man riding on a red horse, and he was standing among the myrtle trees, which were in the deep; and behind him were red, dappled, and white horses.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Quid sunt hæc, Domine mi?
verses.english: And I said, “What are these, my lord?”

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me angelus qui loquebatur in me: Ego ostendam tibi quid ista sint.
verses.english: And the angel who spoke with me said to me, “I will show you what these are.”

verses.latin: Et respondit vir qui stabat inter myrteta, et dixit: Hi sunt quos misit Dominus ut circumeant terram.
verses.english: And the man who was standing among the myrtle trees replied, “These are they whom the Lord has sent to patrol the earth.”

verses.latin: Et responderunt illi: Circuivimus terram, et ecce omnis terra habitatur, et quiescit.
verses.english: And they answered the angel of the Lord who spoke to them, “We have patrolled the earth, and behold, all the earth is inhabited and at rest.”

verses.latin: Et respondit angelus Domini, et dixit: Domine exercituum, usquequo non miserberis Jerusalem, et urbium Juda, quibus iratus es tu iste septuaginta annis?
verses.english: Then the angel of the Lord answered and said, “O Lord of hosts, how long will you not have compassion on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which you have been angry these seventy years?”

verses.latin: Et respondit Dominus angelo qui loquebatur in me, verba bona, verba solationis.
verses.english: And the Lord answered the angel who spoke with me, good words, words of consolation.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me angelus qui loquebatur in me: Clama, dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Zelatus sum Jerusalem, et Sion, zelo magno.
verses.english: And the angel who spoke with me said to me, “Cry out, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: “I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.”’

verses.latin: Et irascor in gentibus opulentis: quia ego iratus sum modice, ipsi vero adjuverunt in malum.
verses.english: And I am exceedingly angry with the nations that are at ease; for I was only a little angry, and they have helped to bring about the evil.”

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus: Revertar ad Jerusalem in misericordiis, et domus mea ædificabitur in ea, dicit Dominus exercituum: et funiculus metatoris extendetur super Jerusalem.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord: “I have returned to Jerusalem with compassion. My house shall be built in it,” says the Lord of hosts, “and the measuring line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.”

verses.latin: Adhuc clama, dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Adhuc redundabit civitates meæ bonis, et adhuc consolabitur Dominus Sion, et adhuc eliget Jerusalem.
verses.english: Cry out again, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: “My cities shall yet again abound with prosperity, and the Lord will again comfort Zion and again choose Jerusalem.”’

verses.latin: Et levavi oculos meos, et vidi: et ecce quatuor cornua.
verses.english: And I lifted up my eyes and saw, and behold, four horns.

verses.latin: Et dixi ad angelum qui loquebatur in me: Quid sunt hæc?
verses.english: And I said to the angel who spoke with me, “What are these?”

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Hæc sunt cornua quæ disperserunt Judam, et Israël, et Jerusalem.
verses.english: And he answered me, “These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”

verses.latin: Et ostendit mihi Dominus quatuor fabros.
verses.english: Then the Lord showed me four smiths.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Quid isti veniunt facere? Qui ait, dicens: Hæc sunt cornua quæ disperserunt Judam, ita ut non levavit caput vir: hi autem venerunt ut exterant ea, cornua gentium, quæ extulerunt cornu contra terram Juda, ut disperderent eam.
verses.english: And I said, “What are these coming to do?” And he said, “These are the horns that scattered Judah, so that no one could lift up his head; and these have come to terrify them, to cast down the horns of the nations, which lifted up their horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.”

verses.latin: Et levavi oculos meos, et vidi, et ecce vir, habens funiculum mensuræ in manu sua.
verses.english: And I lifted up my eyes and looked, and behold, a man holding a measuring line in his hand.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Quo tu vadis? Et dixit ad me: Ut mensurarer Ierusalem, et viderem quanta sit latitudo ejus, et quanta longitudo ejus.
verses.english: So I asked him, “Where are you going?” And he said to me, “To measure Jerusalem, to see how wide it is and how long it is.”

verses.latin: Et ecce angelus, qui loquebatur in me, egressus est, et alius angelus exiit in occursum ejus.
verses.english: Then the angel who was speaking to me went out, and another angel went out to meet him.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eum: Curre, loquere ad puerum istum, dicens: Sine muris habitabitur Ierusalem, propter multitudinem hominum et iumentorum in ea.
verses.english: He said to him, “Run, speak to that young man, saying: ‘Jerusalem will be inhabited without walls, because of the multitude of men and animals in it.’

verses.latin: Et ego, dicit Dominus, ero ei murus ignis in circuitu, et in gloria ero in medio ejus.
verses.english: And I, says the Lord, will be a wall of fire all around her, and I will be glory in the midst of her.”

verses.latin: O, o, fugite de terra septentrionis, dicit Dominus: quoniam in quatuor ventos dispersi vos, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: O, oh, flee from the land of the north, says the Lord: “For I have scattered you to the four winds, says the Lord.”

verses.latin: Exsurge, Sion, quæ habitas cum filia Babylonis.
verses.english: Arise, Zion, you who live with the daughter of Babylon.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Post gloriam misit me ad gentes, quæ rapinam fecerunt vos: quia qui tetigerit vos, tangit pupillam oculi mei.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord of hosts: “After glory He sent me to the nations who plundered you: for he who touches you touches the pupil of My eye.”

verses.latin: Quia ecce ego levo manum meam super eos, et erunt prædæ his, qui serviebant sibi: et scietis quod Dominus exercituum miserit me.
verses.english: For behold, I will raise My hand against them, and they will be plunder for those who served them: and you will know that the Lord of hosts has sent me.”

verses.latin: Canta et laetare, filia Sion, quia ecce ego venio, et habitabo in medio tui, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Sing and rejoice, daughter of Zion, for behold, I come, and I will dwell in your midst, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et applicabuntur gentes multæ ad Dominum in die illa, et erunt mihi in populum: et habitabo in medio tui. Et scies quod Dominus exercituum misit me ad te.
verses.english: And many nations will be joined to the Lord in that day, and they will be My people: and I will dwell in your midst. And you will know that the Lord of hosts has sent me to you.

verses.latin: Et assumet Dominus Judam, partem suam, in terra sanctificata: et eliget adhuc Ierusalem.
verses.english: And the Lord will take possession of Judah, His portion, in the holy land: and He will yet choose Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Sileat omnis caro a facie Domini: quia suscitatus est de habitaculo sancto suo.
verses.english: Let all flesh be silent before the Lord: for He is roused from His holy dwelling.”

verses.latin: Et ostendit mihi Iesum, sacerdotem magnum, stantem coram angelo Domini: et Satan stabat a dextris eius, ut adversaretur ei.
verses.english: The Lord showed me Joshua, the High Priest, standing before the angel of the Lord; and Satan stood at his right hand to accuse him.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Satan: Increpet te Dominus, Satan: increpet te Dominus, qui elegit Ierusalem. Numquid non iste, torris est erutus de igne?
verses.english: And the Lord said to Satan: "May the Lord rebuke you, Satan! May the Lord rebuke you, Satan, who has chosen Jerusalem. Isn't this man like a brand pulled from the fire?"

verses.latin: Et Iesus erat indutus vestibus sordidis: et stabat coram angelo.
verses.english: Now, Joshua was dressed in filthy garments. He stood before the angel.

verses.latin: Qui respondens, dixit ad eos, qui stabant coram eo, dicens: Auferte vestimenta sordida. Et dixit ad eum: Ecce, abstuli a te iniquitatem tuam, et indui te mutatoriis.
verses.english: The angel spoke to those standing before him, saying: "Take off his filthy garments." And he said to Joshua, "Behold, I have removed your iniquity, and I will clothe you in clean garments."

verses.latin: Et dixi: Ponant cidarim mundam super caput eius. Et posuerunt cidarim mundam super caput eius, et induerunt eum vestibus. Et angelus Domini stabat.
verses.english: Then I said, "Let them put a clean turban on his head." So they put a clean turban on his head, and they clothed him with garments. And the angel of the Lord stood by.

verses.latin: Et testificatus est angelus Domini Iesum, dicens:
verses.english: And the angel of the Lord testified to Joshua, saying:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Si in viis meis ambulaveris, et si custodieris observationes meas, tu quoque iudicabis domum meam, et tu quoque ambulaveris in atriis meis: et dabo tibi ambulantes inter istos, qui hic assistunt.
verses.english: "Thus says the Lord of hosts: 'If you walk in my ways, and keep my commandments, you shall judge my house, and you shall also walk in my courts. And I will give you access among those who are standing here.'

verses.latin: Audi, Iesu sacerdos magne, tu et amici tui, qui habitant coram te, quia viri portenti sunt: ecce, ego adducam servum meum Orientem.
verses.english: “Hear, Joshua the High Priest, you and your friends who sit before you, for these men are a sign. Behold, I am bringing my servant, the Branch.

verses.latin: Quia ecce lapis, quem dedi coram Iesu: super unum lapidem septem oculi sunt: ecce ego sculpam sculpturam eius, ait Dominus exercituum: et amovebo iniquitatem terrae in die una.
verses.english: For behold, the stone that I have laid before Joshua, upon one stone are seven eyes. Behold, I will engrave its inscription," says the Lord of hosts, "and I will remove the iniquity of the land in one day.

verses.latin: In die illa, dicit Dominus exercituum, vocabit vir proximus suum sub vite, et vir proximus suum sub ficu.
verses.english: “In that day,” says the Lord of hosts, “every one will invite his neighbor to come under his vine and under his fig tree.”

verses.latin: Et reversus est angelus, qui loquebatur in me, et suscitavit me quasi virum, qui suscitatur de somno.
verses.english: And the angel who was speaking with me came back and roused me, as if he were waking a man from sleep.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Quid tu vides? Et dixi: Vidi, et ecce candelabrum totum aureum, et super caput ejus lucerna, et septem lucernae desuper, et septem fistulae lucernarum, quae erant super caput ejus.
verses.english: He asked me, “What do you see?” I said, “I see a solid gold lampstand, with a bowl at the top. There are seven lamps on the lampstand, each with its own little tube.

verses.latin: Et duo olivae juxta illud, unum a dextris capitis, et unum a sinistris.
verses.english: And on each side of the lampstand stand two olive trees, one on the right side of the bowl and one on the left.

verses.latin: Et respondi, et locutus sum ad angelum, qui loquebatur in me, dicens: Quid sunt haec, Domine mi?
verses.english: I answered, speaking to the angel who was talking with me, and I said, “What are these, my lord?”

verses.latin: Et respondit angelus, qui loquebatur in me, et dixit mihi: Nescis tu quid sunt haec? Et dixi: Non, Domine.
verses.english: The angel who was talking with me answered and said to me, “Don’t you know what these are?” I said, “No, my lord.”

verses.latin: Et respondit, et locutus est mihi, dicens: Haec est sermo Domini ad Zorobabel, dicens: Non in exercitu, nec in robore, sed in spiritu meo, dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: He answered and spoke to me, saying: “This is the Lord's message to Zerubbabel: ‘It is not by army or by strength, but by My Spirit,’ says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Qui tu es, mons magnus, coram Zorobabel? Sed in planum: et proferet lapidem primarium, et exaequabit gratiam ejus. Et exultabunt: gratiam, gratiam super eum.
verses.english: Who are you, great mountain, before Zerubbabel? It will be made level ground; and he will bring forth the cornerstone with shouts of “Grace, grace to it!”

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord's word came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Manus Zorobabel fundaverunt domum istam, et manus ejus perficient eam: et scietis quod Dominus exercituum misit me ad vos.
verses.english: “The hands of Zerubbabel have laid the foundation of this temple; his hands will also complete it.’ Then you will know that the Lord of hosts has sent me to you.

verses.latin: Qui enim spernebat diebus parvis, gaudebit in his, et videbunt laetum lapidem in manu Zorobabel: haec septem oculi Domini sunt, qui discurrunt per universam terram.
verses.english: For whoever has despised the day of small things will rejoice and see the plumb line in the hand of Zerubbabel. These seven are the eyes of the Lord that range throughout the earth.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Quid sunt duae olivae istae, ad dextram candelabri et ad sinistram ejus?
verses.english: Then I said, “What are these two olive trees on the right and the left of the lampstand?”

verses.latin: Et secundo dixi: Quid sunt duae spicae olivarum istarum, quae sunt juxta duo guttura aurea, in quibus sunt rami olivarum?
verses.english: And for the second time I said, “What are these two olive branches beside the two golden spouts that are pouring out golden oil?”

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Nescis quid haec sint? Et dixi: Non, Domine.
verses.english: He asked me, “Don’t you know what these are?” I said, “No, my lord.”

verses.latin: Et dixit: Isti duo filii olei sunt, qui stant coram Domino universae terrae.
verses.english: Then he said, “These are the two anointed ones who stand before the Lord of all the earth.”

verses.latin: Et converti, et levavi oculos meos, et vidi: et ecce volumen volans.
verses.english: I turned, and looked up, and saw: and behold a flying scroll.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Quid tu vides? Et dixi: Video volumen volans: longitudo ejus viginti cubitorum, et latitudo ejus decem cubitorum.
verses.english: He said to me: “What do you see?” And I said: “I see a flying scroll; its length is twenty cubits, and its width ten cubits.”

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Haec est maledictio, quae egredietur super faciem omnis terrae: quia omnis fur, sicut ibi scriptum est, judicatus est: et omnis jurans, sicut ibi scriptum est, innocens erit.
verses.english: Then he said to me: “This is the curse that goes out over the face of the whole earth; because every thief, as it is written, is judged, and everyone who swears falsely, as it is written, will be held as innocent.”

verses.latin: Educo illud, dicit Dominus exercituum, et introibit domum furis, et domum jurantis in nomine meo mendaciter: et morabitur in medio domus ejus, et consumet eam, et ligna ejus, et lapides ejus.
verses.english: “I will send it out,” says the Lord of hosts, “and it will enter the house of the thief, and the house of those who swear falsely in my name; and it will stay inside of that house, and consume it, with its timbers and its stones.”

verses.latin: Et egressus est angelus, qui loquebatur in me, et dixit ad me: Leva oculos tuos, et vide quid est hoc, quod egreditur.
verses.english: Then the angel who was speaking with me came forward, and said to me: “Raise your eyes and see what this is going out.”

verses.latin: Et dixi: Quid est hoc? Et dixit: Haec est epha egrediens. Et dixit: Haec est iniquitas eorum in universa terra.
verses.english: I said: “What is it?” And he said: “It is an ephah measure going out.” And he said: “This is their iniquity throughout the whole earth.”

verses.latin: Et ecce talentum plumbi portabatur, et ecce mulier sedens in medio ephah.
verses.english: And behold, a talent of lead was being carried, and behold, a woman was sitting inside of the ephah.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Haec est impietas. Et projecit eam in medio ephah, et misit lapidem plumbeum in os ejus.
verses.english: And he said: “This is wickedness.” And he cast her into the middle of the ephah, and cast the lead weight over its mouth.

verses.latin: Et levavi oculos meos, et vidi: et ecce duae mulieres egrediebantur, et ventus erat in alis earum: et habebant alas quasi alae ciconiae: et portaverunt epham inter terram et caelum.
verses.english: Then I raised my eyes, and saw: and behold, two women were going out, and the wind was in their wings; and they had wings like the wings of a stork: and they carried the ephah between the land and the sky.

verses.latin: Et dixi ad angelum qui loquebatur in me: Quo isti portant epham?
verses.english: Then I said to the angel who was speaking with me: “Where are these taking the ephah?”

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Ut aedificetur ei domus in terra Sennaar: et stabiliatur, et ponatur ibi super basim suam.
verses.english: And he said to me: “So that a house may be built for it in the land of Shinar, and it may be established, and put there upon its base.”

verses.latin: Et converti, et levavi oculos meos, et vidi: et ecce quattuor venti cæli, qui egrediebantur a medio duorum montium: et montes erant montium æreorum.
verses.english: Then I turned and looked up, and saw four cosmic powers, rising from between two mountains. These mountains were made of bronze.

verses.latin: In curribus primus equorum rufus, et secundo equi nigri,
verses.english: The first chariot had red horses, and the second chariot had black horses,

verses.latin: et tertius equi albi, et quartus equi varii, fortes.
verses.english: the third chariot had white horses, and the fourth chariot had dappled, strong horses.

verses.latin: Et respondi, et dixi ad angelum qui loquebatur in me: Quid sunt hæc, Domine mi?
verses.english: Then I answered, and said to the angel who was speaking with me: “What are these, my Lord?”

verses.latin: Et respondit angelus, et dixit mihi: Hi sunt quattuor venti cæli, qui egrediuntur, et stant coram Domino universitatis.
verses.english: The angel answered, and said to me: “These are the four cosmic powers sent from the heavens. They serve the Lord of all Creation.”

verses.latin: In quibus erant equi nigri, et ibant in terram australem: et albi, et ibant post eos: et varii, et ibant ad terram orientis.
verses.english: The black horses went towards the southern land, and the white horses followed them. The dappled horses went towards the sunrise.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt, et quærebant ut ambularent per terram. Et dixit: Ite, et circuite terram: et circumdederunt terram.
verses.english: Then they went out, and sought to travel through the land. The angel said: “Go and travel the Earth,” and they went around the earth.

verses.latin: Et clamavit me, et locutus est mihi dicens: Ecce qui egrediuntur in terram septentrionalem, requiescere fecerunt spiritum meum in terra septentrionalis.
verses.english: Then he called to me, and spoke to me, saying: “See those who are going to the northern land? They have calmed my spirit in the north.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Accipe a captivitate, ab Holdai, et a Tobia, et a Jedaia, qui venerunt de Babylone: et tu venies in die illa, et intrabis in domum Josiae filii Sophoniae.
verses.english: “Receive gifts from those who were in captivity from Heldai, and from Tobias, and from Jedaiah, who came from Babylon. You will come on that day, and enter the house of Josiah, son of Zephaniah.

verses.latin: Aurum et argentum accipies, et facies coronas, et pones in caput Jesu filii Josedec, sacerdotis magni.
verses.english: Take gold and silver, and make crowns, and place them on the head of Joshua, son of Jehozadak, the high priest.

verses.latin: Et dices ei: Hæc locutus est Dominus exercituum, dicens: Ecce vir Oriens nomen ejus: et subter eum orietur, et ædificabit templum Domino.
verses.english: Say to him: ‘Thus says the Lord of Hosts: “Behold, the man whose name is the Rising Sun. He will arise where he is, and He will rebuild the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Ipse ædificabit templum Domino: et ipse assumet gloriam, et sedebit, et dominabitur super solio suo: et erit sacerdos super solio suo, et consilium pacis erit inter utrumque.
verses.english: He will rebuild the Temple of the Lord; He will take glory and sit and rule on His throne, and He will be a priest on His throne, and there will be peace between the two of them.”

verses.latin: Et coronæ erunt Heleni, et Tobias, et Jedaiae, et Hen filii Sophoniae in memoriale in templo Domini.
verses.english: The crowns will be for Heldai, and Tobias, and Jedaiah, and for the son of Zephaniah, as a memorial in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et longinqui venient, et ædificabunt in templo Domini: et scietis quod Dominus exercituum misit me ad vos. Et hoc erit, si audieritis vocem Domini Dei vestri.
verses.english: Then those who are far away will come and rebuild in the Temple of the Lord; and you will know that the Lord of Hosts has sent me to you. This will happen if you listen to the voice of the Lord your God.”

verses.latin: Factum est autem in anno quarto Darii regis, sermo Domini ad Zachariam, quarta mensis noni, mense Casleu.
verses.english: In the fourth year of King Darius's reign, the Word of the Lord came to Zechariah, on the fourth day of the ninth month, the month of Casleu.

verses.latin: Et missus est ad domum Dei Sarasar et Regemmelech, et viri qui erant cum eis, ut rogarent faciem Domini,
verses.english: And the people of Bethel sent Sarasar and Regemmelech, and the men who were with them, to pray to the Lord.

verses.latin: dicentes ad sacerdotes qui erant in domo Domini exercituum, et ad prophetas, dicentes: Si flebo in mense quinto, sicut feci jam tot annis?
verses.english: They asked the priests who were in the house of the Lord of hosts, and the prophets, saying: “Should I continue to mourn in the fifth month, as I have done for so many years?”

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad omnem populum terrae, et ad sacerdotes, dicens: Cum jejunabatis et plorabatis in quinto et septimo, per hos septuaginta annos, numquid propter me jejunastis?
verses.english: “Speak to all the people of the land, and to the priests, saying: ‘When you fasted and wept in the fifth and seventh months for these seventy years, was it really for Me that you were fasting?’

verses.latin: Et cum comedebatis, et cum bibebatis, nonne vobis ipsi comedebatis, et ipsi bibebatis?
verses.english: And when you ate, and when you drank, weren’t you eating and drinking for your own sakes?

verses.latin: Numquid non verba, quae locutus est Dominus in manu prophetarum priorum, cum esset Jerusalem habitata, et opulenta, et in urbibus ejus per circuitum, et australis, et campestris habitaretur?
verses.english: Did the Lord not give you the same message that He delivered through the prophets who came before, when Jerusalem was inhabited, and prosperous, and when its cities were spread out all around, and the south and the plain were inhabited?”

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad Zachariam, dicens:
verses.english: And the Word of the Lord came to Zechariah, saying:

verses.latin: Haec locutus est Dominus exercituum, dicens: Judicium verum judicate, et misericordiam et miserationes faciatis, unusquisque cum fratre suo.
verses.english: “The Lord of hosts has spoken, saying: ‘Administer true justice, and show mercy and compassion, each one to his brother.’”

verses.latin: Et viduam, et pupillum, et advenam, et pauperem ne calumniemini, et malum frater in corde suo non cogitetis adversus fratrem suum.
verses.english: “Do not oppress the widow, nor the orphan, nor the stranger, nor the poor; and let no man devise evil in his heart against his brother.”

verses.latin: Et noluerunt intendere, et dederunt umerum recedentem, et auribus suis aggravatis, ne audirent.
verses.english: But they refused to listen, and they turned a stubborn shoulder, and their ears were stopped so they would not hear.

verses.latin: Et cor eorum posuerunt ut adamantem, ne audirent legem, et verba quae mittebat Dominus in manu prophetarum priorum: et facta est ira magna a Domino exercituum.
verses.english: They made their hearts as hard as a diamond, so that they would not listen to the Law, and the words that the Lord sent by the hand of the former prophets. Therefore, there came great wrath from the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Et factum est: Sicut clamavit, et non audierunt, sic clamabunt, et non exaudiam, dicit Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: And it came to pass that just as He called out, and they would not listen, so they will cry out, and I will not listen, says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Et turbavi eos in universis gentibus quas nesciebant, et terra desolata est post eos prae transeuntibus, et nullus rediit, et posuerunt terram desiderabilem in solitudinem.
verses.english: And I scattered them among all the nations which they did not know, and the land behind them was desolate as they passed through, and there was no return, and they made the desirable land a desolation.”

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini Zacchariæ, dicens:
verses.english: The Word of the Lord came to Zachariah, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Zelatus sum Sion magno zelo, et magno ardore zelatus sum eam.
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘I am passionately concerned for Zion, and I love her very much.’”

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Revertar ad Sion, et habitabo in medio Jerusalem: et vocabitur Jerusalem urbs veritatis, et mons Domini exercituum, mons sanctificatus.
verses.english: “The Lord says this: ‘I will return to Zion. I will live in the middle of Jerusalem. Jerusalem will be called “the city of truth,” and the mountain of the Lord of Hosts will be called “the holy mountain.”’

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Sedebunt adhuc senes et senes mulieres in plateis Jerusalem, virga in manu eorum præ senio dierum.
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘Old men and old women will sit in the streets of Jerusalem, each with a staff in their hand because of old age.’

verses.latin: Et plateæ civitatis plenas erunt pueris et puellis ludentibus in plateis ejus.
verses.english: ‘And the streets of the city will be full of boys and girls playing in its streets.’

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Si difficile videbitur in oculis reliquiis populi hujus in diebus illis, numquid et in oculis meis difficile erit, dicit Dominus exercituum?
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘It may seem difficult to the remnant of this people at that time, but do you think it will be difficult for me too?’ says the Lord of Hosts?

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Ecce ego salvabo populum meum de terra orientis, et de terra occidentis.
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘I will save my people from the east and the west.’

verses.latin: Et adducam eos, et habitabunt in medio Jerusalem: et erunt mihi in populum, et ego ero eis in Deum, in veritate et in justitia.
verses.english: ‘I will bring them back. They will live in Jerusalem. They will be my people, and I will be their God, with truth and justice.’

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Confortentur manus vestræ qui auditis verba hæc in diebus istis, quibus loquebatur in die domus Domini, ut templum ædificaretur.
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘Be strong, all of you who hear these words in these days, the days when the foundation of the Lord’s house was laid so that the temple might be built.’

verses.latin: Quia ante dies illos non erat merces hominum, nec merces jumentorum, nec paci dabatur pacis causa propter tribulationem: et dimittam omnes homines unumquemque proximum suum.
verses.english: ‘Before those days, there was no pay for people or animals, and there was no peace because of the trouble. I will let every person turn against their neighbor.’

verses.latin: Nunc autem non secundum dies primos, ego enim seminabo semen pacis: vinea dabit fructum suum, et terra dabit germinatum suum, et cæli dabunt rorem suum: et possidere faciam reliquias populi hujus omnia hæc.
verses.english: ‘But now, unlike those former days, I will plant the seeds of peace. The vineyard will produce its fruit. The earth will give its harvest, and the sky will give its dew. I will give all these things to the remnant of my people.’

verses.latin: Et erit: sicut fuistis maledictio in gentibus, domus Juda et domus Israël, sic salvabo vos, et eritis benedictio. Nolite timere: confortentur manus vestræ.
verses.english: ‘Then it will be: just as you, the house of Judah and the house of Israel, were a curse among the nations, so I will save you, and you will be a blessing. Do not be afraid. Be strong!’

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Sicut cogitavi ut maledicerem vobis, cum irascerentur patres vestri, dicit Dominus, et non pœnituduit me,
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘Just as I decided to bring disaster upon you, when your ancestors angered me,’ says the Lord, ‘I did not change my mind,’

verses.latin: sic reversus sum in diebus istis, ut benefaciam Jerusalem et domui Juda: nolite timere.
verses.english: ‘so now I have decided to bring good to Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Do not be afraid.’

verses.latin: Hæc sunt autem verba quæ facietis: Loquimini veritatem unusquisque cum proximo suo: judicium veritatis et pacis judicate in portis vestris.
verses.english: “These are the things you must do: Speak the truth to each other. Judge fairly and justly in your courts.

verses.latin: Et malum proximi sui ne cogitetis in cordibus vestris, et juramentum falsum ne diligatis: omnia enim hæc odio habui, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Do not plan evil against each other. Do not love to swear falsely. I hate all these things,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini exercituum ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Word of the Lord of Hosts came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Jejunium quarti, et jejunium quinti, et jejunium septimi, et jejunium decimi, erit domui Juda in gaudium et in lætitiam, et in solennes dies: sed veritatem et pacem diligite.
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘The fasts of the fourth, fifth, seventh, and tenth months will become times of joy, gladness, and cheerful festivals for the house of Judah. But love truth and peace.’

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Adhuc venient populi et habitatores multarum civitatum:
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘People from many cities will come again,’

verses.latin: et ibunt habitatores unius ad alteram, dicentes: Eamus, et obsecrabimus faciem Domini, et quæramus Dominum exercituum: ego vadam etiam.
verses.english: and the inhabitants of one city will go to another, saying, ‘Let us go and seek the favor of the Lord and search for the Lord of Hosts. I am going, too.’

verses.latin: Et venient multi populi, et gentes fortes, ut quærant Dominum exercituum in Jerusalem, et obsecrent faciem Domini.
verses.english: ‘Many peoples and powerful nations will come to Jerusalem to seek the Lord of Hosts and to implore the favor of the Lord.’

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: In diebus illis, in quibus apprehendent decem viros ex omnibus linguis gentium, et apprehendent, et tenebunt partem viri Judæi, dicentes: Ibi in vobis Deus: audivimus.
verses.english: “The Lord of Hosts says this: ‘In those days, ten men from every language of the nations will grasp the cloak of a Jew, saying, ‘Let us go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.’

verses.latin: Onus verbi Domini in terra Adrach, et Damascum requies ejus: cum oculus hominis et omnium tribuum Israël.
verses.english: This is the prophecy of the Lord about the land of Hadrach. The Lord's protection will fall on Damascus; the eyes of mankind and of all the tribes of Israel are turned to Him.

verses.latin: Et Emath quoque in ea. Tyrum et Sidonem, quia sapientiam fortificaverunt nimis.
verses.english: So too will Hadrach and Hamath; and Tyre and Sidon, because those cities have developed great skill.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit sibi Tyrum munitionem, et coacervavit argentum quasi terram, et aurum quasi lutum viarum.
verses.english: Tyre built itself strongholds and amassed wealth as great as dust, and gold as common as the mud of the streets.

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus possidebit eam, et percutiet in mari fortitudinem ejus, et ipse ignis consumet eam.
verses.english: But the Lord will take away her power. He will cast her strength into the sea, and the city will be consumed by fire.

verses.latin: Aspiciet Ascalon, et timebit, et Gazam, et dolebunt nimis: et Accaron, quia confusa est spes ejus. Et peribit rex de Gaza, et Ascalon non habitabitur.
verses.english: Ashkelon will see it and fear, and Gaza will be in great pain; Ekron will be terrified, for her hope will be gone. The king will perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon will be deserted.

verses.latin: Et habitabit in Azoto macula: et auferam superbiam Philisthim.
verses.english: Foreigners will occupy Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Et auferam de ore ejus sanguinem, et abominationes ejus de medio dentium ejus: et relinquetur ipse reliquus Domino, et erit quasi princeps in Juda, et Accaron quasi Jebusæus.
verses.english: I will take away the blood from their mouths and the abominations from between their teeth. Those who remain will belong to the Lord and will become a part of Judah, and Ekron will join as one of the Israelites.

verses.latin: Et circumdabo domum meam in castris, propter exercitum eorum qui transeunt et revertuntur: et non transibit ultra super eos exactor: quia nunc vidi oculis meis.
verses.english: I will keep my people safe from their enemies, who pass through and return. I will watch over them with my own eyes, and no oppressor will ever come against them again.

verses.latin: Exulta satis, filia Sion: jubila, filia Jerusalem. Ecce rex tuus veniet tibi: justus et salvator: ipse pauper, et ascendens super asinam, et super pullum filium asinae.
verses.english: Rejoice greatly, daughter Zion! Shout, daughter Jerusalem! Look, your king is coming to you! He is righteous and brings salvation! He is humble, riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.

verses.latin: Et confringam quadrigas de Ephraim, et equum de Jerusalem, et confringetur arcus belli: et loquetur pacem gentibus, et potestas ejus a mari usque ad mare, et a flumine usque ad terminos terrae.
verses.english: I will cut off the chariots of Ephraim and the horses of Jerusalem, and the bows of war will be broken. He will proclaim peace to the nations; his dominion will extend from sea to sea and from the Euphrates to the ends of the earth.

verses.latin: Tu quoque in sanguine testamenti tui emisi vinctos tuos de lacu, in quo non est aqua. Redite ad munitionem, vincti spei: et hodie annuntio, duplici reddam tibi.
verses.english: Because of the blood of my covenant with you, I will set your prisoners free from the waterless pit. Return to your stronghold, you prisoners of hope; today I declare that I will restore twice as much to you.

verses.latin: Convertimini ad munitionem, vincti spei: et hodie annuntio, duplici reddam tibi.
verses.english: Return to your stronghold, you prisoners of hope; today I declare that I will restore twice as much to you.

verses.latin: Quia implebo mihi arcum Judae, et implebo sagittam Ephraim: et suscitabo filios tuos, Sion, super filios Græcorum, et ponam te quasi gladium fortis.
verses.english: I will bend Judah as my bow, and I will fit the arrow of Ephraim. I will rouse your sons, Zion, against the sons of Greece; I will make you like a warrior’s sword.

verses.latin: Et apparebit super eos Dominus, et exibit sicut fulgur jaculum ejus: et Dominus Deus clanget in tuba, et vadet in turbinibus australium.
verses.english: Then the Lord will appear over them; his arrow will be like lightning. The Lord God will sound the trumpet and will march in the storms of the south.

verses.latin: Dominus exercituum proteget eos: et comedent, et subicient lapides fundæ: et potabunt quasi vinum, et implebuntur quasi crateres, et quasi cornua altaris.
verses.english: The Lord of Hosts will protect them. They will eat and will trample the sling stones; they will drink and roar as if drunk with wine; they will be filled with blood like bowls, like the corners of the altar.

verses.latin: Et salvabit eos Dominus Deus eorum in die illa, quasi gregem populi sui: quia lapides sancti elevantur super terram illius.
verses.english: On that day the Lord their God will save them, like the flock of his people. For they will be like the jewels of a crown, gleaming over his land.

verses.latin: Quam bonum est, et quam pulchrum: frumentum electorum et vinum germinans virgines.
verses.english: How beautiful and good they are, the grain of the elect, and the new wine that makes virgins flourish!

verses.latin: Petite a Domino pluviam in tempore serotino: et Dominus faciet imbres, et dabit eis singulis pabula in agro.
verses.english: Beseech the Lord, and He will give rain at the appointed time: then the Lord will make the clouds gather, and He will give them food in the field.

verses.latin: Idola enim loquuti sunt vana: et divini viderunt mendacium, et somnia loquuntur frustra: frustra consolantur. Idcirco abierunt quasi oves: afflicti sunt, quia non erat pastor.
verses.english: False gods speak empty words; the soothsayers have seen lies and spoken in vain; they console in vain. Therefore, they have wandered away like sheep, and are afflicted because there is no shepherd.

verses.latin: Contra pastores iratus est furor meus: et visitabo super hircos. Quia visitavit Dominus virtutem suam, exercitum suum, Judam, et posuit eum quasi equum gloriae suae in bello.
verses.english: My wrath is kindled against the shepherds, and I will punish the leaders. For the Lord of hosts will visit His flock, the house of Judah, and will make them as a glorious horse in battle.

verses.latin: Ex eo lapis angularis, ex eo paxillus, ex eo arcus belli: ex eo egredietur omnis simul.
verses.english: From Judah will come the cornerstone, from him the peg, from him the bow of war. From him, will the strength of all of them come forth.

verses.latin: Et erunt quasi fortes viri, calcantes lutum platearum in bello: et pugnabunt, quia Dominus cum eis.
verses.english: And they shall be as mighty men, trampling the mire of the streets in battle, and they shall fight, because the Lord is with them.

verses.latin: Et confundam domum Juda, et domum Joseph salvabo: et reducam eos, quia miserebor eorum: et erunt sicut fuerunt, quando non projeceram eos. Quia ego Dominus Deus eorum exaudiam eos.
verses.english: And I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph, and I will restore them, because I will have mercy on them, and they shall be as they were before I had cast them off. For I am the Lord their God, and I will hear them.

verses.latin: Et erit quasi fortis Ephraim: et laetabitur cor eorum quasi vino: et filii eorum videbunt et laetabuntur, et cor eorum gaudebit in Domino.
verses.english: And Ephraim shall be as a mighty man, and their heart shall rejoice as if with wine, and their children shall see it, and shall rejoice, and their heart shall be glad in the Lord.

verses.latin: Sibilabo eis, et congregabo eos: quia redemi eos: et multiplicabo eos sicut ante fuerant.
verses.english: I will whistle for them, and I will gather them, because I have redeemed them, and I will multiply them as before.

verses.latin: Et dispergam eos in populis, et in longinquis memorabunt mei: et vivent cum filiis suis, et convertentur.
verses.english: And I will disperse them among the peoples, and in distant lands they will remember Me, and they shall live with their children, and shall turn back to Me.

verses.latin: Et reducam eos de terra Aegypti: et de Assur congregabo eos: et ad terram Galaad, et Libanum adduxero eos, et non invenietur eis locus.
verses.english: And I will bring them back from the land of Egypt, and I will gather them from Assyria, and I will bring them to the land of Gilead and Lebanon, and there will be no room for them.

verses.latin: Et transibit in mari angustia: et percutiet in mari fluctus, et omnes profunditates fluminis siccabuntur: et auferetur superbia Assur, et sceptrum Aegypti.
verses.english: And they shall pass through the sea of tribulation, and He shall strike down the waves in the sea, and all the depths of the river shall be dried up, and the pride of Assyria shall be taken away, and the scepter of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et confortabo eos in Domino, et in nomine ejus gaudebunt, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: And I will strengthen them in the Lord, and in His name they shall rejoice, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Aperies, o Libane, portas tuas, et comedet ignis cedros tuas.
verses.english: Open your gates, Lebanon, so the fire will devour your cedars.

verses.latin: Ulula, abies, quia cecidit cedrus, quoniam magnifici vastati sunt: ululate, quercus Basan, quoniam succisa est silva munitissima.
verses.english: Howl, fir tree, because the cedar has fallen. The mighty are ruined. Howl, oaks of Bashan, because the impenetrable forest has been cut down.

verses.latin: Vox ululatus pastorum, quia vastata est magnificentia eorum: vox rugitus leonum, quoniam vastata est superbia Jordanis.
verses.english: Listen to the shepherds' cries of grief, because their glory is ruined. Listen to the lions' roaring, because the pride of the Jordan is ruined.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus meus: Pasce pecus occisionis,
verses.english: Thus says the Lord, my God: "Shepherd the flock that is being slaughtered.

verses.latin: quorum qui possidebant, interficiebant eos, et non dolebant: et qui vendebant eos, dicebant: Benedictus Dominus, ditiores facti sumus: et pastores eorum non pepercerunt eis.
verses.english: Those who possessed them killed them without regret. Those who sold them said, 'Blessed is the Lord, for we have become rich!' and their shepherds show them no pity.

verses.latin: Quia non parcens iterum habitatorum terræ, ecce ego tradam homines, unumquemque in manu proximi sui, et in manu regis sui: et conterent terram, et non dimittam de manu eorum.
verses.english: Because I will no longer pity the inhabitants of the land, behold, I will cause men to fall into the hands of their neighbors and into the hands of their kings. They will crush the land, and I will not deliver it from their hands."

verses.latin: Et pascam pecus occisionis propter hoc, o pauperes gregis. Et assumpsi mihi duos virga: unam, vocavi Gratiam, et aliam, vocavi Funiculum: et pavi gregem.
verses.english: So I shepherded the flock that was being slaughtered, that is, the poor of the flock. And I took for myself two staffs: one I named Favor, and the other I named Union. And I tended the flock.

verses.latin: Et disperdi tres pastores in mense uno: et defecit anima mea in eis, et anima ipsorum conatus est in me.
verses.english: I dismissed the three shepherds in one month. My soul became impatient with them, and their souls also detested me.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Non pascam vos: quæ morientia, moriantur: et quæ interibunt, intereant: et reliquæ devorent, unusquisque carnem proximi sui.
verses.english: Then I said, "I will not be your shepherd. Let the dying die, and those who are perishing, perish. Let those who are left devour each other's flesh!"

verses.latin: Et assumpsi virgam meam, Gratiam, et confregi eam, ut irritum facerem pactum quod pepigeram cum cunctis populis.
verses.english: Then I took my staff, Favor, and I broke it, because I was breaking the covenant that I had made with all the peoples.

verses.latin: Et confracta est in die illa: et cognoverunt sic pauperes gregis, qui custodiunt me, quod verbum Domini esset.
verses.english: So it was broken on that day, and the poor of the flock, who were watching me, knew that it was the word of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dixi ad eos: Si bonum est in oculis vestris, date mercedem meam: et si non, quiescite. Et appenderunt mercedem meam triginta argenteos.
verses.english: Then I said to them, "If it seems right to you, give me my wages; and if not, keep them." So they weighed out my wages, thirty pieces of silver.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi Dominus: Projice illud in figuli, pretium honoris quo honoratus sum a eis. Et sumpsi triginta argenteos, et projeci eos in domum Domini ad figulum.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me, "Throw it to the potter”—the price at which they valued me. So I took the thirty pieces of silver and threw them into the house of the Lord, to the potter.

verses.latin: Et confregi secundum virgam meam, Funiculum, ut dissolverem fraternitatis inter Judam et Israël.
verses.english: Then I broke my second staff, Union, to break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi Dominus: Adhuc assume tibi instrumenta pastorum stultorum.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: "Take for yourself again the instruments of a worthless shepherd.

verses.latin: Quia ecce ego suscitabo pastorem in terra, qui derelicta non visitabit, et dispersa non quæret, et contritum non sanabit, et id quod stat, non sustentabit: et carnes pinguium comedet, et ungulas eorum conteret.
verses.english: For behold, I am going to raise up a shepherd in the land, who will not care for the lost, nor seek the scattered, nor heal the injured, nor feed the healthy. He will devour the flesh of the fat sheep and tear off their hooves.

verses.latin: Væ pastori idolo, qui derelinquit gregem! gladius super brachium ejus, et super oculum dextrum ejus: brachium ejus aridum arescat, et oculus dexter ejus caligabit.
verses.english: Woe to the worthless shepherd, who abandons the flock! May a sword strike his arm and his right eye! May his arm be utterly withered, and his right eye become utterly dark!"

verses.latin: Onus verbi Domini in terra Adrach, et Damascum, requies ejus: cum oculus hominis et omnes tribus Israël.
verses.english: This is what the Lord said about the future of the earth. The Lord has set His judgment against the land of Hadrach, and He will bring His rest on Damascus. All of humankind, and all the tribes of Israel, will turn toward the Lord.

verses.latin: Et Hamath quoque in ea: et Tyrum et Sidonem, sapientes ejus.
verses.english: The Lord will also judge Hamath. And the Lord will bring down Tyre and Sidon, along with their wisdom.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit sibi Tyrus munitionem, et coacervavit argentum quasi lutum, et aurum quasi cespitem platearum.
verses.english: Tyre has built fortresses to protect itself. The people have stored up silver like dirt and gold like mud in the streets.

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus possidebit eam, et percutiet in mari fortitudinem ejus, et ipsa igni consumetur.
verses.english: The Lord will defeat it, and destroy its power in the sea. And the city of Tyre will be consumed by fire.

verses.latin: Videbit Ascalon, et timebit, et Gaza, et dolebunt nimis: et Accaron, quoniam confusa est spes ejus: et peribit rex de Gaza, et Ascalon non habitabitur.
verses.english: Ashkelon will see the destruction and be afraid. And Gaza will be in agony. And Ekron will be ashamed, for it was wrong to put its hope in itself. And the king of Gaza will be destroyed, and Ashkelon will be deserted.

verses.latin: Et habitabit in Azoto extraneus, et detraham superbiam Philisthinorum.
verses.english: Foreigners will live in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Et auferam sanguinem de ore ejus, et abominationes ejus de medio dentium ejus: et relinquetur et ipse reliquiae Domino, et erit quasi princeps in Juda, et Accaron quasi Jebusaeus.
verses.english: I will take away the blood from their mouths, and the evil things they eat from their teeth. And their remaining people will belong to the Lord, and they will be like a tribal chief in Judah, and Ekron will be like the Jebusites.

verses.latin: Et circumdabo domum meam in castris, propter exercitum eorum qui transeunt et revertuntur, et non transibit ultra super eos exactor: quia nunc vidi oculis meis.
verses.english: I will set up My camp to protect My house from the army that comes and goes, and no oppressor will ever pass through them again, for I have seen this with My own eyes.

verses.latin: Exultans vehementer filia Sion, praedica filia Jerusalem: ecce rex tuus veniet tibi, justus, et salvator: ipse pauper, et ascendens super asinam, et super pullum filium asinae.
verses.english: Daughter of Zion, be joyful and proclaim the good news! Daughter of Jerusalem, shout! Behold, your king is coming to you, just and victorious! He is meek and riding on a donkey, even on a colt, the foal of a donkey.

verses.latin: Et consumam quadrigas de Ephraim, et equum de Jerusalem, et confringetur arcus belli: et loquetur pacem gentibus, et potestas ejus a mari usque ad mare, et a flumine usque ad terminos terrae.
verses.english: I will remove the chariots from Ephraim, and the horses from Jerusalem, and the weapons of war will be broken. And the king will speak peace to the nations, and his power will stretch from sea to sea, and from the Euphrates River to the ends of the earth.

verses.latin: Tu quoque in sanguine testamenti tui emisi vinctos tuos de lacu, in quo non est aqua.
verses.english: I am the one who liberated your prisoners from the waterless pit because of the blood of My covenant.

verses.latin: Convertimini ad munitionem, vincti spei: et in hodierno quoque annuntiabo, reddebo tibi duplicia.
verses.english: Return to your fortress, you prisoners who still have hope. Even today, I will tell you that I will restore to you double what you have lost.

verses.latin: Quia extendam mihi Judam, quasi arcum, impleboque sagittam Ephraim: et suscitabo filios tuos Sion super filios Græcorum, et ponam te quasi gladium fortis.
verses.english: I will use Judah as My bow. I will fill it with Ephraim like an arrow. I will rouse up your sons, O Zion, against the sons of Greece. And I will make you like a warrior's sword.

verses.latin: Et apparebit Dominus super eos, et exibit sicut fulgur jaculum ejus: et Dominus Deus in tuba canet, et ibit in tempestatibus austri.
verses.english: Then the Lord will appear over them. And His arrow will flash like lightning. The Lord God will blow the trumpet. And He will go forth in the tempests of the south.

verses.latin: Dominus exercituum proteget eos: et comedent, et subvertent lapides fundæ, et bibent, et inebriabuntur quasi vino, et replebuntur quasi pateris, et quasi cornibus altaris.
verses.english: The Lord of hosts will protect them. They will eat and will trample on the sling stones. They will drink, and they will be drunk as if they had drunk wine. They will be filled as a bowl is filled, and as the corners of the altar are filled.

verses.latin: Et salvos faciet eos Dominus Deus eorum in die illa, sicut gregem populi sui: quia lapides sancti erunt, elevati super terram ejus.
verses.english: The Lord their God will save them on that day, as the flock of His people, because they are like precious stones. They will shine forth over the land of God.

verses.latin: Quam bonum est enim ejus, et quam speciosa, frumentum electorum, et vinum germinans virgines.
verses.english: How good and beautiful they will be! The grain of the chosen ones will flourish, and the wine will cause young women to grow.

verses.latin: In die illa erit fons patens domui David, et habitantibus Ierusalem, ad eluendum peccatorem et immundum.
verses.english: At that time, a fountain will gush forth for the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, to wash away sin and impurity.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa, dicit Dominus exercituum, disperdam nomina idolorum de terra, et non memorabuntur ultra: et prophetas, et spiritum inmundum auferam de terra.
verses.english: On that day, says the Lord of hosts, I will destroy the idols from the land. They will never be remembered again. I will take away the false prophets and the spirit of uncleanness from the land.

verses.latin: Et erit cum prophetaverit quispiam ultra, dicent ei pater ejus et mater ejus, qui genuerunt eum: Non vives, quia mendacium locutus es in nomine Domini. Et configent eum pater ejus et mater ejus, qui genuerunt eum, cum prophetaverit.
verses.english: If anyone dares to prophesy again, his father and mother, who brought him forth, will say, “You will not live, because you have spoken falsely in the name of the Lord.” His father and mother, who bore him, will pierce him through when he prophesies.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa, confundentur prophetae, singuli visiones suas, cum prophetaverint, nec induentur pallio ut mentiantur:
verses.english: On that day, the prophets will be ashamed of their visions when they prophesy. They will not wear a hairy cloak to deceive others,

verses.latin: dicentes: Non sum propheta, vir agricola ego sum: quia Adam est terra mea.
verses.english: But rather say, “I am not a prophet; I am a farmer. The land is my inheritance.”

verses.latin: Et dicetur ad eum: Quid sunt plagae istae in medio manuum tuarum? Et dicet: Illae, quibus percussus sum in domo eorum, qui diligebant me.
verses.english: And if someone asks, “What are these wounds on your body?”, they will reply, “I got these wounds in the house of my friends.”

verses.latin: Gladius, suscitare super pastorem meum, et super virum consortem meum, dicit Dominus exercituum: et percutiam pastorem, et dispergentur oves: et convertam manum meam super pusillos.
verses.english: Awake, O sword, against my shepherd, and against the man who is my associate, says the Lord of hosts. Strike the shepherd, that the sheep may be scattered, and I will turn my hand against the little ones.

verses.latin: Et erit in omni terra, dicit Dominus, partes duae in ea interibunt, et exhalabuntur: tertia autem pars relinquetur in ea.
verses.english: In all the land, says the Lord, two parts in it will perish and be consumed, but the third part will be left in it.

verses.latin: Et adducam tertiam partem per ignem, et uram eos, sicut uritur argentum, et probabo eos, sicut probatur aurum. Ipse vocabit nomen meum, et ego exaudiam eum. Dicam: Populus meus est, et ipse dicet: Dominus Deus meus.
verses.english: I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine them as silver is refined, and test them as gold is tested. They will call upon my name, and I will hear them. I will say, “They are my people,” and they will say, “The Lord is my God.”

verses.latin: Ecce dies Domini veniet, et dispergetur spolia tua in medio tui.
verses.english: Behold, the day of the Lord will come, and all the treasures you have will be scattered in your midst.

verses.latin: Et congregabo omnes gentes ad Ierusalem ad praelium, et capietur urbs, et vastabuntur domus, et mulieres violabuntur: et egredietur dimidium civitatis in captivitatem, et reliquum populi non auferetur ex urbe.
verses.english: I will gather all the nations to Jerusalem for war, and the city will be captured, and the houses will be destroyed, and the women will be raped. Half of the city will be led away into captivity, but the rest of the people will not be taken out of the city.

verses.latin: Et egredietur Dominus, et proeliabitur contra gentes illas, sicut proeliatus est in diebus belli.
verses.english: Then the Lord will go forth and fight against those nations, as He fought in the day of battle.

verses.latin: Et stabunt pedes ejus in die illa super montem Oliveti, qui est contra Jerusalem ad orientem: et scindetur mons Oliveti ad medium, contra orientem et occidentem, plaga magna nimis: et separabitur dimidium montis ad aquilonem, et dimidium ejus ad meridiem.
verses.english: On that day His feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, which is east of Jerusalem. The Mount of Olives will be split in two from east to west, forming a very large valley. Half of the mountain will move toward the north, and half toward the south.

verses.latin: Et fugietis in vallem montium meorum, quia conjungietur vallis montium ad proximam: et fugietis sicut fugistis a facie terraemotus in diebus Oziae regis Juda: et veniet Dominus Deus meus, omnesque sancti cum eo.
verses.english: You will flee into the valley of my mountains, because the valley of the mountains will reach to Azal. You will flee as you fled from the earthquake in the days of Uzziah, king of Judah. Then the Lord my God will come, and all the saints with Him.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: non erit lux, sed frigus et gelu.
verses.english: On that day there will be no light, but there will be cold and frost.

verses.latin: Et erit dies una, quae nota est Domino: non dies neque nox: et in tempore vespere erit lux.
verses.english: It will be a unique day that is known to the Lord, neither day nor night, but at evening time there will be light.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: exibunt aquae viventes de Jerusalem: dimidium earum ad mare orientale, et dimidium earum ad mare occidentale: hieme et aestate erunt.
verses.english: On that day, living waters will flow out from Jerusalem, half to the eastern sea and half to the western sea; they will flow in both summer and winter.

verses.latin: Et erit Dominus rex super universam terram: in die illa erit Dominus unus, et nomen ejus unum.
verses.english: And the Lord will be king over all the earth; on that day the Lord will be one, and His name one.

verses.latin: Et convertetur omnis terra in campum, a Gabaa usque ad Remmon, ad austrum Jerusalem: et exaltabitur, et habitabitur in loco suo, a porta Beniamin usque ad locum prioris portae, usque ad angulum portae angulorum: et a turre Hananeel usque ad torcularia regis.
verses.english: The whole land will be turned into a plain, from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem. Jerusalem will be raised up and inhabited in its place, from the Gate of Benjamin to the place of the First Gate, to the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananeel to the king's wine presses.

verses.latin: Et habitabunt in ea, et non erit ultra anathema: sed habitabit Jerusalem secura.
verses.english: People will live in it, and there will be no more curse, but Jerusalem will be secure.

verses.latin: Haec est plaga qua percutiet Dominus omnes gentes, quae pugnaverunt contra Jerusalem: tabescet caro eorum stantes super pedibus suis, et oculi eorum tabescunt in foraminibus suis, et lingua eorum tabescet in ore suo.
verses.english: This will be the plague with which the Lord will strike all the nations that fought against Jerusalem: their flesh will rot while they are still standing, their eyes will rot in their sockets, and their tongues will rot in their mouths.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: erit tumultus Domini magnus in eis, et apprehendet vir manum proximi sui, et conseretur manus ejus manui proximi sui.
verses.english: On that day a great panic from the Lord will fall on them, so that each one will seize the hand of his neighbor, and his hand will be raised against the hand of his neighbor.

verses.latin: Sed et Juda pugnabit in Jerusalem: et congregabuntur omnes gentes contra eam.
verses.english: Judah also will fight at Jerusalem, and all the nations will be gathered against her.

verses.latin: Et erit: sicut erat omnis qui ingrediebatur in Jerusalem, ita erit plaga eorum: et consumetur caro eorum, et oculi eorum in foraminibus suis, et lingua eorum in ore suo.
verses.english: This will be the plague that strikes the horses, the mules, the camels, the donkeys, and all the animals that are in those camps. The same plague will be on all who enter Jerusalem: their flesh will be consumed, and their eyes will rot in their sockets, and their tongues will rot in their mouths.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: ponentur super tinnitus equorum, sanctitas Domino: et erunt lebetes in domo Domini quasi vasorum coram altari.
verses.english: On that day, even the bells on the horses will be inscribed with “holy to the Lord.” The cooking pots in the house of the Lord will be like the bowls before the altar.

verses.latin: Et erit omnis lebes in Jerusalem et in Juda sanctificatus Domino exercituum: et omnes sacrificantes venient, et sumunt ex eis, et coquent in eis: et non erit mercator in domo Domini exercituum in die illa.
verses.english: Every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holy to the Lord of hosts, and all who sacrifice will come and take some of the pots to cook in. On that day, there will no longer be any traders in the house of the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: In die illa erit: scriptum est super frenis equorum: Sanctum Domino: et erunt lebetes in domo Domini quasi vasorum coram altari.
verses.english: On that day, it will be written on the bells of the horses: “Holy to the Lord.” The cooking pots in the house of the Lord will be like the bowls before the altar.

verses.latin: Et erit omnis qui relictus fuerit de universis gentibus, quae venerint contra Jerusalem, ascendet ab anno in annum ut adoret regem, Dominum exercituum, et faciet solemnitatem tabernaculorum.
verses.english: Every one who is left of all the nations that came against Jerusalem will go up year after year to worship the King, the Lord of hosts, and to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.latin: Et erit: qui non ascenderit de familiis terrae ad Jerusalem, ut adoret regem, Dominum exercituum, non erit super eos pluvia.
verses.english: If any of the families of the earth do not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the Lord of hosts, there will be no rain for them.

verses.latin: Quod si familia Aegypti non ascenderit, nec venerit, non erit super eos: erit plaga, qua percutiet Dominus gentes, quae non ascenderint ad celebrandum solemnitatem tabernaculorum.
verses.english: And if the family of Egypt does not go up and come, there will be no rain for them; there will be the plague with which the Lord strikes the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.latin: Hoc erit peccatum Aegypti, et peccatum omnium gentium, quae non ascenderint ad celebrandum solemnitatem tabernaculorum.
verses.english: This will be the punishment of Egypt and of all the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.latin: In die illa erit: super frenis equorum, sanctitas Domino: et erunt lebetes in domo Domini quasi vasorum coram altari.
verses.english: On that day there will be inscribed on the bells of the horses, “Holy to the Lord.” The cooking pots in the house of the Lord will be like the bowls before the altar.
